According to the problem statement, when the constant current source is connected, the Ampere force is given by $F_{1}=n B I l$.
During the time interval $0 {\sim} t_{1}$, the mover and the coil undergo uniformly accelerated linear motion with an acceleration of $a={\frac{v_{1}}{t_{1}}}$.
According to Newton's second law, we have $F_{1}=(M+m)a$.
Substituting the values and solving the simultaneous equations, we get $I={\frac{(m+M)v_{1}}{n l B t_{1}}}=80\mathrm{A}$.
